head.title: Teenagers Accused of Hate Crime Assault

hedline.hl1: Teenagers Accused of Hate Crime Assault

abstract.p: Three black Staten Island teenagers are charged with assault and robbery in attack on group of white teenagers that police describe as 'hate crime' (S)

block.p: In an attack that the authorities described as a hate crime, three black Staten Island teenagers were charged with assault and robbery yesterday in an attack on a group of white teenagers.

The police said the black teenagers were part of a group of 10 young men who surrounded six white teenagers in West Brighton at 8 p.m. Monday and shouted profanity-laced, antiwhite remarks. The taunting descended into violence, the police said, when three black teenagers began to punch three of the white youths.
In an attack that the authorities described as a hate crime, three black Staten Island teenagers were charged with assault and robbery yesterday in an attack on a group of white teenagers.

The police said the black teenagers were part of a group of 10 young men who surrounded six white teenagers in West Brighton at 8 p.m. Monday and shouted profanity-laced, antiwhite remarks. The taunting descended into violence, the police said, when three black teenagers began to punch three of the white youths.
''The motivating factor behind the attacks was that the victims were white,'' one investigator said. ''They said they had a problem with white people being in their neighborhood.''
The attacks occurred near the intersection of Post Avenue and Clove Road, the police said.

One of the attackers was wearing brass knuckles, the police said. One victim, a 14-year-old boy, had a concussion, and another had extensive cuts on his face. The attackers robbed the victims of a silver bracelet, a MetroCard, a personal stereo and $16 in cash, the police said.

Two of the teenagers -- Anthony McCoy, 17, and his brother Peter McCoy, 16, both of 45 Holland Avenue -- were charged as adults with multiple counts of second-degree assault and aggravated harassment. A third teenager, 14, faces the same counts but his name is being withheld because he was charged as a juvenile.
All three were also charged with robbery.
